comments: Number of units of a(n) belongs to a periodic sequence: 0, 1, 8, 3, 6, 5, 4, 7, 2, 9. - Mohamed Bouhamida (bhmd95(AT)yahoo.fr), Sep 04 2009This sequence gives the values of y in solutions of the Diophantine equation x^2 - 15*y^2 = 1; the corresponding values of x are in A001091. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 12 2010 [edited by _Jon E. Schoenfield_, May 02 2014]For n>= 2, a(n) equals the permanent of the (n-1) X (n-1) tridiagonal matrix with 8's along the main diagonal, and i's along the superdiagonal and the subdiagonal (i is the imaginary unit). - _John M. Campbell_, Jul 08 2011For n>=1, a(n) equals the number of 01-avoiding words of length n-1 on alphabet {0,1,...,7}. - _Milan Janjic_, Jan 25 2015
